verses.verse: Woe<WH1945> to them that decree<WH2710> unrighteous<WH205> decrees,<WH2711> and that write<WH3789> grievousness<WH5999> which they have prescribed;<WH3789>

To turn<WH5186> aside<WH5186> the needy<WH1800> from judgment,<WH1779> and to take<WH1497> away<WH1497> the right<WH4941> from the poor<WH6041> of my people,<WH5971> that widows<WH490> may be their prey,<WH7998> and that they may rob<WH962> the fatherless!<WH3490>

And what<WH4100> will you do<WH6213> in the day<WH3117> of visitation,<WH6486> and in the desolation<WH7722> which shall come<WH935> from far?<WH4801> to whom<WH4310> will you flee<WH5127> for help?<WH5833> and where<WH575> will you leave<WH5800> your glory?<WH3519>

Without<WH1115> me they shall bow<WH3766> down<WH3766> under<WH8478> the prisoners,<WH616> and they shall fall<WH5307> under<WH8478> the slain.<WH2026> For all<WH3605> this<WH2063> his anger<WH639> is not turned<WH7725> away, but his hand<WH3027> is stretched<WH5186> out still.<WH5750>
O Assyrian,<WH804> the rod<WH7626> of my anger,<WH639> and the staff<WH4294> in their hand<WH3027> is my indignation.<WH2195>

I will send<WH7971> him against an hypocritical<WH2611> nation,<WH1471> and against<WH5921> the people<WH5971> of my wrath<WH5678> will I give him a charge,<WH6680> to take<WH7997> the spoil,<WH7998> and to take<WH962> the prey,<WH957> and to tread<WH7760> <WH4823> them down like the mire<WH2563> of the streets.<WH2351>

However, he means<WH1819> not so,<WH3651> neither<WH3808> does his heart<WH3824> think<WH2803> so;<WH3651> but it is in his heart<WH3824> to destroy<WH8045> and cut<WH3772> off nations<WH1471> not a few.<WH4592>
For he said,<WH559> Are not my princes<WH8269> altogether<WH3162> kings?<WH4428>
Is not Calno<WH3641> as Carchemish?<WH3751> is not Hamath<WH2574> as Arpad?<WH774> is not Samaria<WH8111> as Damascus?<WH1834>
As my hand<WH3027> has found<WH4672> the kingdoms<WH4467> of the idols,<WH457> and whose graven<WH6456> images did excel them of Jerusalem<WH3389> and of Samaria;<WH8111>
Shall I not, as I have done<WH6213> to Samaria<WH8111> and her idols,<WH457> so<WH3651> do<WH6213> to Jerusalem<WH3389> and her idols?<WH6091>

Why it shall come<WH1961> to pass, that when<WH3588> the Lord<WH136> has performed<WH1214> his whole<WH854> <WH3605> work<WH4639> on mount<WH2022> Zion<WH6726> and on Jerusalem,<WH3389> I will punish<WH6485> the fruit<WH6529> of the stout<WH1433> heart<WH3824> of the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> and the glory<WH8597> of his high<WH7312> looks.<WH5869>

For he said,<WH559> By the strength<WH3581> of my hand<WH3027> I have done<WH6213> it, and by my wisdom;<WH2451> for I am prudent:<WH995> and I have removed<WH5493> the bounds<WH1367> of the people,<WH5971> and have robbed<WH8154> their treasures,<WH6259> and I have put<WH3381> down<WH3381> the inhabitants<WH3427> like a valiant<WH3524> man:

And my hand<WH3027> has found<WH4672> as a nest<WH7064> the riches<WH2428> of the people:<WH5971> and as one gathers<WH622> eggs<WH1000> that are left,<WH5800> have I gathered<WH622> all<WH3605> the earth;<WH776> and there was none<WH3808> that moved<WH5074> the wing,<WH3671> or opened<WH6475> the mouth,<WH6310> or peeped.<WH6850>

Shall the ax<WH1631> boast<WH6286> itself against<WH5921> him that hews<WH2672> therewith? or shall the saw<WH4883> magnify<WH1431> itself against<WH5921> him that shakes<WH5130> it? as if the rod<WH7626> should shake<WH5130> itself against them that lift<WH7311> it up, or as if the staff<WH4294> should lift<WH7311> up itself, as if it were no<WH3808> wood.<WH6086>

Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> shall the Lord,<WH113> the Lord<WH136> of hosts,<WH6635> send<WH7971> among his fat<WH4924> ones leanness;<WH7332> and under<WH8478> his glory<WH3519> he shall kindle<WH3344> a burning<WH3350> like the burning<WH3350> of a fire.<WH784>

And the light<WH216> of Israel<WH3478> shall be for a fire,<WH784> and his Holy<WH6918> One for a flame:<WH3852> and it shall burn<WH1197> and devour<WH398> his thorns<WH7898> and his briers<WH8068> in one<WH259> day;<WH3117>

And shall consume<WH3615> the glory<WH3519> of his forest,<WH3293> and of his fruitful<WH3759> field, both soul<WH5315> and body:<WH1320> and they shall be as when a standard-bearer<WH5264> faints.<WH4549>
And the rest<WH7605> of the trees<WH6086> of his forest<WH3293> shall be few,<WH4557> that a child<WH5288> may write<WH3789> them.

And it shall come<WH1961> to pass in that day,<WH3117> that the remnant<WH7605> of Israel,<WH3478> and such as are escaped<WH6413> of the house<WH1004> of Jacob,<WH3290> shall no<WH3808> more<WH5750> again<WH3254> stay<WH4937> on him that smote<WH5221> them; but shall stay<WH8172> on the LORD,<WH3068> the Holy<WH6918> One of Israel,<WH3478> in truth.<WH571>
The remnant<WH7605> shall return,<WH7725> even the remnant<WH7605> of Jacob,<WH3290> to the mighty<WH1368> God.<WH410>

For though<WH518> your people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478> be as the sand<WH2344> of the sea,<WH3220> yet a remnant<WH7605> of them shall return:<WH7725> the consumption<WH3631> decreed<WH2782> shall overflow<WH7857> with righteousness.<WH6666>
For the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069> of hosts<WH6635> shall make<WH6213> a consumption,<WH3617> even determined,<WH2782> in the middle<WH7130> of all<WH3605> the land.<WH776>

Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> thus<WH3541> said<WH559> the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069> of hosts,<WH6635> O my people<WH5971> that dwell<WH3427> in Zion,<WH6726> be not afraid<WH3372> of the Assyrian:<WH804> he shall smite<WH5221> you with a rod,<WH7626> and shall lift<WH5375> up his staff<WH4294> against<WH5921> you, after the manner<WH1870> of Egypt.<WH4714>
For yet<WH5750> a very<WH4213> little<WH4592> while, and the indignation<WH2195> shall cease,<WH3615> and my anger<WH639> in their destruction.<WH8399>

And the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> shall stir<WH5782> up a whip<WH7752> for him according to the slaughter<WH4347> of Midian<WH4080> at the rock<WH6697> of Oreb:<WH6157> and as his rod<WH4294> was on the sea,<WH3220> so shall he lift<WH5375> it up after the manner<WH1870> of Egypt.<WH4714>

And it shall come<WH1961> to pass in that day,<WH3117> that his burden<WH5448> shall be taken<WH5493> away<WH5493> from off<WH5921> your shoulder,<WH7926> and his yoke<WH5923> from off<WH5921> your neck,<WH6677> and the yoke<WH5923> shall be destroyed<WH2254> because<WH6440> of the anointing.<WH8081>
He is come<WH935> to Aiath,<WH5857> he is passed<WH5674> to Migron;<WH4051> at Michmash<WH4363> he has laid<WH6485> up his carriages:<WH3627>

They are gone<WH5674> over<WH5674> the passage:<WH4569> they have taken<WH3885> up their lodging<WH4411> at Geba;<WH1387> Ramah<WH7414> is afraid;<WH2729> Gibeah<WH1390> of Saul<WH7586> is fled.<WH5127>
Lift<WH6670> up your voice,<WH6963> O daughter<WH1323> of Gallim:<WH1554> cause it to be heard<WH7181> to Laish,<WH3919> O poor<WH6041> Anathoth.<WH6068>
Madmenah<WH4088> is removed;<WH5074> the inhabitants<WH3427> of Gebim<WH1374> gather<WH5756> themselves to flee.

As yet<WH5750> shall he remain<WH5975> at Nob<WH5011> that day:<WH3117> he shall shake<WH5130> his hand<WH3027> against the mount<WH2022> of the daughter<WH1004> of Zion,<WH6726> the hill<WH1389> of Jerusalem.<WH3389>

Behold,<WH2009> the Lord,<WH113> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts,<WH6635> shall lop<WH5586> the bough<WH6288> with terror:<WH4637> and the high<WH7312> ones of stature<WH6967> shall be hewn<WH1438> down,<WH1438> and the haughty<WH1364> shall be humbled.<WH8213>
And he shall cut<WH5362> down the thickets<WH5442> of the forest<WH3293> with iron,<WH1270> and Lebanon<WH3844> shall fall<WH5307> by a mighty<WH117> one.
